verses.kjv: So king Solomon was king over all Israel.
verses.web: King Solomon was king over all Israel.
verses.ct: King Solomon ruled over all of Israel.

verses.kjv: And these were the princes which he had; Azariah the son of Zadok the priest,
verses.web: These were the princes whom he had: Azariah the son of Zadok, the priest;
verses.ct: These were his top officials: Azariah son of Zadok served as priest;

verses.kjv: Elihoreph and Ahiah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder.
verses.web: Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder;
verses.ct: Elihoreph and Ahiah, sons of Shisha, served as scribes; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was the official recorder;

verses.kjv: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the host: and Zadok and Abiathar were the priests:
verses.web: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the army; Zadok and Abiathar were priests;
verses.ct: Benaiah son of Jehoiada commanded the army; Zadok and Abiathar served as priests;

verses.kjv: And Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers: and Zabud the son of Nathan was principal officer, and the king’s friend:
verses.web: Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers; Zabud the son of Nathan was chief minister, the king’s friend;
verses.ct: Azariah son of Nathan supervised the district officers; Zabud son of Nathan was chief minister and the king's personal advisor;

verses.kjv: And Ahishar was over the household: and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the tribute.
verses.web: Ahishar was over the household; and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the men subject to forced labor.
verses.ct: Ahishar managed the royal household; and Adoniram son of Abda was in charge of the forced labor crews.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, which provided victuals for the king and his household: each man his month in a year made provision.
verses.web: Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, who provided food for the king and his household. Each man had to make provision for a month in the year.
verses.ct: Solomon also appointed 12 district officers over all Israel. Their job was to supply food for the king and his household, with each officer responsible for one month out of the year.

verses.kjv: And these are their names: The son of Hur, in mount Ephraim:
verses.web: These are their names: Ben Hur, in the hill country of Ephraim;
verses.ct: Here are their names: Ben Hur, over the hill country of Ephraim;

verses.kjv: The son of Dekar, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Bethshemesh, and Elonbethhanan:
verses.web: Ben Deker, in Makaz, in Shaalbim, Beth Shemesh, and Elon Beth Hanan;
verses.ct: Ben Dekar, over Makaz, Shaalbim, Bethshemesh, and Elonbethhanan;

verses.kjv: The son of Hesed, in Aruboth; to him pertained Sochoh, and all the land of Hepher:
verses.web: Ben Hesed, in Arubboth (Socoh and all the land of Hepher belonged to him);
verses.ct: Ben Hesed, over Aruboth, including Sochoh and the entire region of Hepher;

verses.kjv: The son of Abinadab, in all the region of Dor; which had Taphath the daughter of Solomon to wife:
verses.web: Ben Abinadab, in all the height of Dor (he had Taphath, Solomon’s daughter, as wife);
verses.ct: Ben Abinadab, over the entire region of Dor — he was married to Solomon's daughter Taphath;

verses.kjv: Baana the son of Ahilud; to him pertained Taanach and Megiddo, and all Bethshean, which is by Zartanah beneath Jezreel, from Bethshean to Abelmeholah, even unto the place that is beyond Jokneam:
verses.web: Baana the son of Ahilud, in Taanach and Megiddo, and all Beth Shean which is beside Zarethan, beneath Jezreel, from Beth Shean to Abel Meholah, as far as beyond Jokmeam;
verses.ct: Baana son of Ahilud, over Taanach, Megiddo, and all of Bethshean near Zartanah below Jezreel, stretching from Bethshean to Abelmeholah and beyond Jokneam;

verses.kjv: The son of Geber, in Ramothgilead; to him pertained the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; to him also pertained the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, threescore great cities with walls and brasen bars:
verses.web: Ben Geber, in Ramoth Gilead (the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead, belonged to him; and the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, sixty great cities with walls and bronze bars, belonged to him);
verses.ct: Ben Geber, over Ramothgilead, including the towns of Jair son of Manasseh in Gilead, as well as the region of Argob in Bashan — 60 large cities fortified with walls and bronze bars;

verses.kjv: Ahinadab the son of Iddo had Mahanaim:
verses.web: Ahinadab the son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;
verses.ct: Ahinadab son of Iddo, over Mahanaim;

verses.kjv: Ahimaaz was in Naphtali; he also took Basmath the daughter of Solomon to wife:
verses.web: Ahimaaz, in Naphtali (he also took Basemath the daughter of Solomon as wife);
verses.ct: Ahimaaz, over Naphtali — he too had married one of Solomon's daughters, Basmath;

verses.kjv: Baanah the son of Hushai was in Asher and in Aloth:
verses.web: Baana the son of Hushai, in Asher and Bealoth;
verses.ct: Baanah son of Hushai, over Asher and Aloth;

verses.kjv: Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar:
verses.web: Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar;
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat son of Paruah, over Issachar;

verses.kjv: Shimei the son of Elah, in Benjamin:
verses.web: Shimei the son of Ela, in Benjamin;
verses.ct: Shimei son of Elah, over Benjamin;

verses.kjv: Geber the son of Uri was in the country of Gilead, in the country of Sihon king of the Amorites, and of Og king of Bashan; and he was the only officer which was in the land.
verses.web: Geber the son of Uri, in the land of Gilead, the country of Sihon king of the Amorites and of Og king of Bashan; and he was the only officer who was in the land.
verses.ct: Geber son of Uri, over the land of Gilead — the territory that once belonged to King Sihon of the Amorites and King Og of Bashan. He was the sole officer over that entire region.

verses.kjv: Judah and Israel were many, as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking, and making merry.
verses.web: Judah and Israel were numerous as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking and making merry.
verses.ct: The people of Judah and Israel were as countless as sand on the seashore. They had plenty to eat and drink, and they lived in celebration.

verses.kjv: And Solomon reigned over all kingdoms from the river unto the land of the Philistines, and unto the border of Egypt: they brought presents, and served Solomon all the days of his life.
verses.web: Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the River to the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt. They brought tribute and served Solomon all the days of his life.
verses.ct: Solomon ruled over every kingdom from the Euphrates River to the land of the Philistines and all the way to the border of Egypt. These kingdoms paid tribute and served Solomon for his entire life.

verses.kjv: And Solomon’s provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and threescore measures of meal,
verses.web: Solomon’s provision for one day was thirty cors of fine flour, sixty measures of meal,
verses.ct: The daily provisions required for Solomon's court were 30 cors of fine flour and 60 measures of meal,

verses.kjv: Ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and an hundred sheep, beside harts, and roebucks, and fallowdeer, and fatted fowl.
verses.web: ten head of fat cattle, twenty head of cattle out of the pastures, and one hundred sheep, in addition to deer, and gazelles, and roebucks, and fattened fowl.
verses.ct: 10 fattened cattle, 20 pasture-fed cattle, and 100 sheep — plus deer, gazelles, roebucks, and fattened fowl.

verses.kjv: For he had dominion over all the region on this side the river, from Tiphsah even to Azzah, over all the kings on this side the river: and he had peace on all sides round about him.
verses.web: For he had dominion over all on this side the River, from Tiphsah even to Gaza, over all the kings on this side the River: and he had peace on all sides around him.
verses.ct: Solomon controlled everything west of the Euphrates, from Tiphsah all the way to Azzah, ruling over every king in that region. He enjoyed peace on every side.

verses.kjv: And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, from Dan even to Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.
verses.web: Judah and Israel lived safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, from Dan even to Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.
verses.ct: Throughout Solomon's reign, everyone in Judah and Israel lived in safety — each person secure under their own vine and fig tree, from Dan in the north to Beersheba in the south.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
verses.web: Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
verses.ct: Solomon had 40,000 stalls of horses for his chariots and 12,000 horsemen.

verses.kjv: And those officers provided victual for king Solomon, and for all that came unto king Solomon’s table, every man in his month: they lacked nothing.
verses.web: Those officers provided food for king Solomon, and for all who came to king Solomon’s table, every man in his month. They let nothing be lacking.
verses.ct: The 12 district officers kept King Solomon's table fully supplied, providing for everyone who ate at his court during their assigned month. Nothing was ever lacking.

verses.kjv: Barley also and straw for the horses and dromedaries brought they unto the place where the officers were, every man according to his charge.
verses.web: They also brought Barley and straw for the horses and swift steeds to the place where the officers were, each man according to his duty.
verses.ct: They also delivered barley and straw for the horses and swift steeds to wherever the officers were stationed, each man fulfilling his assigned duty.

verses.kjv: And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea shore.
verses.web: God gave Solomon abundant wisdom and understanding, and very great understanding, even as the sand that is on the seashore.
verses.ct: God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding beyond measure — a mind as vast and boundless as sand on the seashore.

verses.kjv: And Solomon’s wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east country, and all the wisdom of Egypt.
verses.web: Solomon’s wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east and all the wisdom of Egypt.
verses.ct: Solomon's wisdom surpassed that of all the wise men of the east and all the wisdom of Egypt.

verses.kjv: For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Chalcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all nations round about.
verses.web: For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, Heman, Calcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all the nations all around.
verses.ct: He was wiser than anyone — wiser than Ethan the Ezrahite, Heman, Chalcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol. His fame spread to every surrounding nation.

verses.kjv: And he spake three thousand proverbs: and his songs were a thousand and five.
verses.web: He spoke three thousand proverbs; and his songs numbered one thousand five.
verses.ct: He composed 3,000 proverbs, and he wrote 1,005 songs.

verses.kjv: And he spake of trees, from the cedar tree that is in Lebanon even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall: he spake also of beasts, and of fowl, and of creeping things, and of fishes.
verses.web: He spoke of trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon even to the hyssop that grows out of the wall; he also spoke of animals, of birds, of creeping things, and of fish.
verses.ct: He could speak knowledgeably about every kind of plant, from the great cedars of Lebanon to the tiny hyssop growing out of a wall. He also taught about animals, birds, reptiles, and fish.

verses.kjv: And there came of all people to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, which had heard of his wisdom.
verses.web: People of all nations came to hear the wisdom of Solomon, sent by all kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.
verses.ct: People came from every nation to hear Solomon's wisdom, sent by kings from all over the earth who had heard how wise he was.
